article.headline: Ark.-Pine Bluff 58, Texas Southern 56
article.story: PINE BLUFF, Ark. -- Tavaris Washington's tip-in with just a second left in the game gave Arkansas-Pine Bluff a 58-56 comeback win over Texas Southern on Saturday night. With 8 seconds left, DeAndre Hall of Texas Southern hit a layup to tie the game at 56. But then Terrance Calvin of Arkansas-Pine Bluff took the inbounds pass the length of the court. He missed the potential game-winner, but Washington, who had only four points on the night, tipped the ball in as time ran out. Calvin and freshman Savalance Townsend led the Golden Lions (5-12, 4-2 SWAC) with 13 points apiece. Matthew Miller had 21 points for Texas Southern (1-18, 1-5). The Golden Lions trailed 27-23 at the half then outscored Texas Southern 35-29 in the second half.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
